dex1: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.
dex2: Silently it glides, drawing near its targets. Before they even notice it, it begins to pelt them with vicious kicks.

dex1: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.
dex2: It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.

dex1: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.
dex2: Although basically cool and cautious, when it's caught by surprise, it's seized by panic.

dex1: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.
dex2: It doesn't allow its emotions to be easily seen. Earning its trust takes time. It prefers solitude.

dex1: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.
dex2: It boasts powerful front legs. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.

dex1: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it's not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer's orders with complete nonchalance.
dex2: After hurling ferocious punches and flinging furious kicks, it finishes opponents off by spewing fire from around its navel.

dex1: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It's famous for being a hard worker.
dex2: This Pokémon can control water bubbles. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.

dex1: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards its enemies.
dex2: It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try and help.

dex1: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.
dex2: Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle. This Pokémon's Trainer must prioritize the daily maintenance of its throat at all costs.

dex1: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.
dex2: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth.

dex1: It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak. When it encounters enemies or prey, it fires off all the seeds in a burst.
dex2: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of calls and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.

dex1: When it battles, its beak heats up. The temperature can easily exceed 212 degrees Fahrenheit, causing severe burns when it hits.
dex2: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.

dex1: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.
dex2: It wanders around in a never-ending search for food. At dusk, it collapses from exhaustion and falls asleep on the spot.

dex1: When it finds a trace of its prey, it patiently stakes out the location...but it's always snoozing by nightfall.
dex2: It adores having Rattata and Raticate for dinner, but as it's diurnal, it never encounters them. This Pokémon boasts incredible patience.

dex1: Its strong jaw enables it to scrape trees and slurp out the sap. It normally lives underground.
dex2: They often gather near places frequented by electric Pokémon in order to avoid being attacked by bird Pokémon.

dex1: Its body is capable of storing electricity. On camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.
dex2: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.

dex1: It zips around, on sharp lookout for an opening. It concentrates electrical energy within its large jaws and uses it to zap its enemies.
dex2: It produces electricity via an electrical organ in its abdomen. It overwhelms bird Pokémon with shocking beams of electrical energy.

dex1: While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. When it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.
dex2: It punches so much, its pincers often come off from overuse, but they grow back quickly. What little meat they contain is rich and delicious.

dex1: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokémon evolved and grew fur.
dex2: It just throws punches indiscriminately. In times of desperation, it can lop off its own pincers and fire them like rockets.

dex1: It beats its wings together to create fire. As it moves in the steps of its beautiful dance, it bathes opponents in intense flames.
dex2: This Oricorio has sipped red nectar. Its passionate dance moves cause its enemies to combust in both body and mind.

dex1: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it's able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.
dex2: Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers.

dex1: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.
dex2: Some of Ribombee's pollen puffs are highly nutritious. They are sometimes sold as supplements.

dex1: It's considered to be a good Pokémon for beginners because of its friendliness, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.
dex2: This Pokémon has lived with people since times long ago. It can sense when its Trainer is in the dumps and will stick close by its Trainer's side.

dex1: Its quick movements confuse its enemies. Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons.
dex2: When properly raised from a young age, it will become a trustworthy partner that will absolutely never betray its Trainer.

dex1: When it's in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.
dex2: It's awfully weak and notably tasty, so everyone is always out to get it. As it happens, anyone trying to bully it receives a painful lesson.

dex1: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.
dex2: It's found crawling on beaches and seafloors. The coral that grows on Corsola's head is as good as a five-star banquet to this Pokémon.

dex1: Toxapex crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.
dex2: Those attacked by Toxapex's poison will suffer intense pain for three days and three nights. Post-recovery, there will be some aftereffects.

dex1: The mud stuck to Mudbray's hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.
dex2: It has a stubborn, individualistic disposition. Eating dirt, making mud, and playing in the mire all form part of its daily routine.

dex1: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.
dex2: Its heavy, mud-covered kicks are its best means of attack, and it can reduce large trucks to scrap without breaking a sweat.

dex1: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.
dex2: When it comes across enemies or potential prey, this Pokémon smashes its water-bubble-covered head into them.

dex1: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.
dex2: Despite what its appearance suggests, it cares for others. If it finds vulnerable, weak Pokémon, it protectively brings them into its water bubble.

dex1: During the day, it sleeps and soaks up light. When night falls, it walks around looking for a safer place to sleep.
dex2: They give off a sweet and refreshing scent. Cutiefly often gather near the tall grass where Fomantis are hiding.

dex1: It requires a lot of effort to maintain Lurantis's vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.
dex2: It fires beams from its sickle-shaped petals. These beams are powerful enough to cleave through thick metal plates.

dex1: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.
dex2: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.

dex1: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.
dex2: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokémon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.

dex1: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.
dex2: Volcanoes or dry, craggy places are its home. It emanates a sweet-smelling poisonous gas that attracts bug Pokémon, then attacks them.

dex1: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.
dex2: Filled with pheromones, its poisonous gas can be diluted to use in the production of luscious perfumes.

dex1: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.
dex2: A touch from anyone except a known friend sends it into a surging frenzy. It's an incredibly dangerous Pokémon.

dex1: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.
dex2: This Pokémon has the habit of hugging its companions. Many Trainers have left this world after their spines were squashed by its hug.

dex1: A delectable aroma pours from its body. They are often swallowed whole by Toucannon lured by that wafting deliciousness.
dex2: Although it's too sugary for human consumption, Bounsweet's sweat can be watered down into a juice with just the right amount of sweetness.

dex1: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokémon, this Pokémon is totally fine.
dex2: This Pokémon is always bouncing around energetically. Other Pokémon are attracted by its lively appearance and pleasant aroma.

dex1: Its long, striking legs aren't just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.
dex2: A Pokémon known for the beauty of its well-shaped legs, it sometimes appears as a mascot in advertisements for beauty salons.

dex1: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. This revitalizes the flowers, and they give off an aromatic scent.
dex2: Baths prepared with the flowers from its vine have a relaxing effect, so this Pokémon is a hit with many people.

dex1: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokémon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so it's best suited to veteran Trainers.
dex2: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.

dex1: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkableâ€”they will never let down a comrade.
dex2: They battle with hard berries for weapons. Their techniques are passed from the boss to the group, generation upon generation.

dex1: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.
dex2: Its habitat varies from beaches to seabeds. A natural scavenger, it will gleefully chow down on anything edible, no matter how rotten.

dex1: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawaterâ€”or even airâ€”right in two.
dex2: It battles skillfully with its six arms, but spends most of its time peacefully meditating in caves deep beneath the sea.

dex1: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this Pokémon embodies the grudges of the departed.
dex2: It takes control of anyone who puts a hand in its mouth. And so it adds to the accumulation of its sand-mound body.

dex1: Possessed people controlled by this Pokémon transformed its sand mound into a castle. As it evolved, its power to curse grew ever stronger.
dex2: Buried beneath the castle are masses of dried-up bones from those whose vitality it has drained.

dex1: It lives in shallow seas, such as areas near a beach. It can eject its internal organs, which it uses to engulf its prey or battle enemies.
dex2: These Pokémon line the beaches. The sticky mucous that covers their bodies can be used to soothe sunburned skin. How convenient!

dex1: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.
dex2: Due to the danger that this synthetic Pokémon may go on a rampage, it wears a control mask to restrain its power.

dex1: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. This Pokémon is capable of changing its type, a flexibility that is well displayed in battle.
dex2: Although its name was Type: Null at first, the boy who evolved it into this form gave it the name by which it is now known.

dex1: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.
dex2: Strong impacts can knock it out of its shell. This Pokémon was born from mutated nanoparticles.

dex1: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.
dex2: The log it holds was given to it by its parents at birth. It has also been known to cling to the arm of a friendly Trainer.

dex1: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.
dex2: It gushes fire and poisonous gases from its nostrils. Its dung is an explosive substance and can be put to various uses.

dex1: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.
dex2: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.

dex1: Its actual appearance is unknown. A scholar who saw what was under its rag was overwhelmed by terror and died from the shock.
dex2: A lonely Pokémon, it conceals its terrifying appearance beneath an old rag so it can get closer to people and other Pokémon.

dex1: When it unleashes its psychic power from the protuberance on its head, the grating sound of grinding teeth echoes through the area.
dex2: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder's shell is no match for it.

dex1: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its intense breath.
dex2: This Pokémon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.

dex1: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.
dex2: The soul of seaweed adrift in the waves became reborn as this Pokémon. It maintains itself with new infusions of seabed detritus and seaweed.

dex1: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.
dex2: They live in mountains where no trace of humans can be detected. Jangmo-o grow little by little as they battle one another.

dex1: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.
dex2: It sheds and regrows its scales on a continuous basis. The scales become harder and sharper each time they're regrown.

dex1: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.
dex2: Its rigid scales function as offense and defense. In the past, its scales were processed and used to make weapons and other commodities.

dex1: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.
dex2: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.

dex1: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.
dex2: As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health on the spot.

dex1: It pulls large trees up by the roots and swings them around. It causes vegetation to grow, and then it absorbs energy from the growth.
dex2: The guardian deity of Ula'ula is a lazy Pokémon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.

dex1: The dense fog it creates brings the downfall and destruction of its confused enemies. Ocean currents are the source of its energy.
dex2: The guardian deity of Poni, it can control water. People say it can create pure water that will wash away any uncleanness.

dex1: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.
dex2: In ages past, it was called the child of the stars. It's said to be a Pokémon from another world, but no specific details are known.

dex1: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of the stars.
dex2: There's something accumulating around the black core within its hard shell. People think this Pokémon may come from another world.

dex1: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.
dex2: This Pokémon is said to be a male evolution of Cosmog. At the activation of its third eye, it departs for another world.

dex1: It is said to be a female evolution of Cosmog. When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.
dex2: Said to live in another world, this Pokémon devours light, drawing the moonless dark veil of night over the brightness of day.

dex1: One of several mysterious Ultra Beasts. People on the street report observing those infested by it suddenly becoming violent.
dex2: One of the Ultra Beasts. It's unclear whether or not this Pokémon is sentient, but sometimes it can be observed behaving like a young girl.

dex1: This Ultra Beast appeared from another world. It shows off its body, but whether that display is a boast or a threat remains unclear.
dex2: A mysterious life-form called an Ultra Beast. Witnesses saw it pulverize a dump truck with a single punch.

dex1: One of the dangerous Ultra Beasts, it has been spotted running across the land at terrific speeds.
dex2: One of the Ultra Beasts. It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.

dex1: One of the mysterious life-forms known as Ultra Beasts. Astonishing electric shocks emanate from its entire body, according to witnesses.
dex2: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so people think it energizes itself with electricity.

dex1: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. Witnesses observed it flying across the sky at high speed.
dex2: One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.

dex1: This Ultra Beast came from the Ultra Wormhole. It seems not to attack enemies on its own, but its sharp body is a dangerous weapon in itself.
dex2: One of the Ultra Beast life-forms, it was observed cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade.

dex1: It has gobbled mountains and swallowed whole buildings, according to reports. It's one of the Ultra Beasts.
dex2: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.

dex1: Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
dex2: Light is apparently the source of its energy. It has an extraordinarily vicious disposition and is constantly firing off laser beams.

dex1: This artificial Pokémon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak.
dex2: Its mechanized body is merely a vessel. Its true self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.

dex1: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before humans, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.
dex2: It lurks in the shadows of others, copying their movements and powers. This Pokémon is craven and cowering.
